VII.i.4.A.6.g
.
Processing a Claim for Survivors Benefits From an Alleged Foster Parent
Follow the steps in the table below to process a claim for survivors benefits from an individual who claims to be the foster parent of a deceased Veteran.
Step
Action
1
Is the claimant seeking entitlement to DIC?
If
yes
, go to the next step.
If
no
, go to Step 3.
2
Does the claimant’s income exceed the limit referenced in
M21-1, Part VII, Subpart i, 4.A.2.d
?
If
yes
,
deny the claim for DIC, and
go to Step 13.
If
no
, go to Step 4.
3
Is the claimant dependent, per
M21-1, Part VII, Subpart i, 4.A.2.e
?
If
yes
, go to the next step.
If
no
,
deny the claim for death compensation, and
go to Step 13.
4
Send
VA Form 21P-524, Statement of Person Claiming to Have Stood in Relation of Parent
, to the claimant for completion within 30 days.
Go to the next step after the
earlier
of the following occurs:
the claimant returns
VA Form 21P-524
, or
30 days pass without a response from the claimant.
5
Does the evidence of record indicate the alleged foster parent stood in the place of the Veteran’s parent for the one-year period referenced in
M21-1, Part VII, Subpart i, 4.A.6.a
?
If
yes
, go to the next step.
If
no
, go to Step 12.
6
Was a biological or adoptive parent of the same sex as the alleged foster parent living at the time the foster parent relationship is alleged to have arisen?
If
yes
, go to Step 10.
If
no
, go to the next step.
7
Must VA treat the alleged foster parent’s claim as a contested claim, per the principle discussed in
M21-1, Part VII, Subpart i, 4.A.6.d
?
If
yes
,
undertake the development actions described in
M21-1, Part VI, Subpart iii, 3.B
, and
go to the next step after the
earlier
of the following occurs:
all parties to the contested claim respond to the development actions, or
30 days pass after giving all parties to the contested claim an opportunity to respond to the development actions.
If
no
,
award survivors benefits, and
go to Step 13.
8
Prepare an administrative decision according to the instructions in
M21-1, Part VI, Subpart iii, 3.C.1.a and b
.
9
Take the actions described in
M21-1, Part VI, Subpart iii, 3.C.2-4
and disregard the remaining steps in this table.
10
Fully develop the facts concerning relinquishment of control.
Obtain the certified statement of the biological or adoptive parent, if possible.
Request a field examination, if necessary.
11
Does the evidence of record indicate the Veteran’s biological or adoptive parent (whichever applies) relinquished parental control?
If
yes
, return to Step 7.
If
no
, go to the next step.
12
Prepare a two-signature administrative decision using the format referenced in
M21-1, Part X, Subpart v, 1.C.2
.
Following approval of the decision, deny the claimed benefit.
13
Notify the claimant of the decision.
Reference
:  For more information on notifying claimants of a VA decision, see
M21-1, Part VI, Subpart i, 1.B
.
